summary: Feature request for a catch-all signal handler in TypeScript workflows to ensure in-order delivery of all signals regardless of type. Currently requires either a single signal type or multiple individual handlers, making it difficult to guarantee ordering across different signal types.
userImpact: Developers must use workarounds (single signal type or fat handler) to guarantee in-order signal processing across multiple signal types.
proposedFix: Add a setGlobalSignalHandler API that acts as a catch-all for any signal type not handled by specific handlers, with catch-all only triggering when no more specific handler is defined.
workaround: Use a single 'fat handler' signal type or only define one signal handler to process all signals in order.
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented with catch-all handler API added to SDK.
keyQuote: Easy to add, has been brought up before, API TBD. For the behavior, I'd recommend this being a catch all, meaning it doesn't get triggered if a more specific handler is set.
